CatDescriptText: Mrs. Mozelle Lockhart, 929 Crescent Street and Miss Anna Lee, Salem Ohio, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 7, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think adults in the community are doing enough to foster constructive recreational activities, like playgrounds, centers, places to dance, Little Leagues, etc., for youth?" Mrs. Mozelle Lockhart's answer reads: "I think so. They have the "Y" for swimming and there is also a center in Sweickley which holds dances for youth of the Coraopolis area and surround communities.  The youth program is complete from kindergarten up to teen-agers."  Miss Anna Lee's answer reads: "We don't have any community recreational facilities and the people in my town are not doing anything about the situation."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Mozelle Lockhart, wearing striped trench coat, and Anna Lee, standing in front of block wall with store windows on either side
